trg_text: Cabinet met on Wednesday, 10 May 2017, at Tuynhuys, Cape Town World Economic Forum on Africa Cabinet welcomes the successful hosting of the 27th World Economic Forum on Africa, which saw President Jacob Zuma leading Team South Africa, Heads of State and Governments from the African continent, global captains of industry and commerce and civil society leadershi The conference was held under the theme:

trg_text: Government has committed to bringing dignity to South Africans through the provision of sanitation service The main focus during the week will be the priority Bucket Eradication Programm This will see the handover of waterborne sanitation to communities in the Nketoana Local Municipality, Free State and Dawid Kruiper Local Municipality, Northern Cape, as part of accelerating services to replace bucket toilet South Africa is celebrating Africa Month under the theme:

src_text: Kuzuza kukhula lokuphelele: baholi labaphendvulako nalabanakekelayo .Leseshini ye-27 yeForamu Yetemnotfo Yemhlaba lemayelana ne-Afrika (i-WEFA) icinisekise umhlaba kabusha kutsi iNingizimu Afrika iyachubeka nekuba live lelinemandla lekungatjalwa kulo imali kulelivekati lase-Afrik Bachumanisi bacinisekise kutsi betingetulu kwe-1000 titfunywa lebetingenele lomcimbi, linani lelingakate selibe khona phambilini uma kucatsaniswa ne-WEFA yaphambiliniUmoya lonemandla webudlelwano emkhatsini wahulumende kanye nabosomabhizinisi ngesikhatsi se-WEFA bewumuhle ngalokusezingeni leliphakeme kakhul Lengcoco lenotsile inike iNingizimu Afrika litfuba lekukhombisa inchubelekelembili leyentako mayelana nekuzuza kukhula kwemonotfo lophelele noma-ke lofaka konkhe ekhatsi kanye nekukhombisa kutsi iNingizimu Afrika ivulekele ibhizinis INingizimu Afrika itinikele kuchubeka nekufezekisa Luhlelo Lwekutfutfukisa Lwavelonkhe (i-NDP) kute kuncishiswe emazinga ebuphuya, kungalingani kanye nekweswelakala kwemisebenti TitfutsiKwetfulwa kwetitimela letinsha te-Ejensi YaseNingizimu Afrika Yetitimela Letitfutsa Bantfu (i--Prasa) netinsita tetitimela, nguMengameli Jacob Zuma mhla ti-9 Inkhwekhweti 2017 eSiteshini ePitoli yincenye yekutinikela kwahulumende lokuchubekako kucinisekisa kuba khona kwetitfutsi letingabiti kakhulu futsi letititfutsi temmango lekungatsenjelwa kuto, tiphindze futsi tente sakhiwonchanti semnotfo walelive kutsi sibe ncon Titimela letinsha (tekutfutsa Bantfu) takaMetrorail tiyincenye yetitimela letinsha letitawetsengwa nguhulumende
trg_text: This 27th session of the WEF on Africa reaffirmed to the world that South Africa remains part of the potential investment destination in the African continen The organisers confirmed that more than 1 000 delegates attended the event, a number that is unprecedented when compared with the previous WEF on Afric The strong spirit of partnership between government and the business community during WEF on Africa was extremely positiv The rich discussion afforded South Africa an opportunity to showcase progress it was making towards an inclusive economic growth and to demonstrate that South Africa is open to busines South Africa remains committed to staying on course in implementing its National Development Plan

trg_text: travelling experienc It is part of government s economic development through massive infrastructure development and it is disability friendl Cabinet made a call to all South Africans to be proud of and protect the new trains against acts of vandalism Vuwani protest Cabinet welcomes the successful intervention by President Zuma in Vuwani, Limpop The President met with His Majesty King Toni Mphephu Ramabulana of Vha-Venda and other community stakeholders to find amicable solutions to issues raise The meeting accepted His Majesty's proposal that the Vhembe District Municipality should provide services to the people of Vuwani while a lasting solution on the demarcation issue is being sough The proposed resolution is in line with applicable legislation governing municipalitie It was further decided that relevant national and provincial government departments should provide support to the district municipality to carry out this new mandat The meeting however, emphasized that the decision does not mean that the new municipality (LIM 345) is being disestablishe This decision is part of government s commitment to finding an inclusive solutio The engagement of the President and all the stakeholders resulted in schooling and business operations returning to norma Cabinet commends the stakeholders for enforcing the implementation of the agreements brokered by the Kin The President has committed to returning and interacting with the community of Vuwani on a date still to be finalised with His Majesty King Toni Mphephu Ramabulana and all the relevant stakeholders in the are Cabinet appeals to parents and the community to support the departmental interventions to ensure that learners are back in class and focus on learning and catching up through interventions being rolled out at all schools Violent protests

trg_text: Cabinet urges communities to refrain from violence, intimidation and looting when they raise their concern The violence and acts of looting and the destruction of business properties that took place recently in Coligny, Eldorado Park, and Ennerdale is strongly condemned by Cabine Cabinet calls on communities to raise their concerns in a manner that seeks solutions without necessarily destroying public property or infringing on the rights of other members of societ During his State of the Nation Address in 2015, President Zuma made a call

src_text: INingizimu Afrika njengencenye yenhlangano yemave emhlaba lelwa nemisebenti yetimali lengekho emtsetfweni, itawuhambisana nekungenelela kwemave emhlaba lokuhlose kulwa nekutfolwa kwetinsambansamba tetimali ngalokungekho emtsetfweni kanye nekwesekelwa kwebuphekulasikhuni ngetimalLoMtsetfosivivinyo utawufaka ligalelo ekuciniseni kwenta tintfo ngekungafihli lutfo kanye nesizotsa kunchubo yetimali yaseNingizimu uphindze futsi wente kutsi kube lukhuni kakhulu kutsi tigebengu letibandzakanyeka ekungakhokheni umtselo, kutfola tinsambansamba temali ngalokungekho emtsetfweni kungena nekuphuma kwetimali lokungekho emtsetfweni kugwema kusebentisa tinchubo tetimali taseNingizimu Afrik Wenta incenye yelamanye emathulusi lesinawo njengelive lesihlasela ngawo bugebengu lobentiwa bocwepheshe emkhakheni wahulumende newangasesINdvuna yeTetimali
trg_text: Cabinet urges all stakeholders to engage with the view to speedily resolving the disputes in Ennerdale, Eldorado Park and Coligny Financial Intelligence Centre Amendment Act Cabinet welcomes the signing of the Financial Intelligence Centre Amendment Bill into law by President Zum South Africa, as part of the global community that is aligned with fighting illegal financial activities, will be aligned to the international intervention that seeks to fight money laundering and financing of terroris This Bill will also contribute to strengthening the transparency and integrity of the South African financial system and make it harder for criminals involved in tax evasion, money laundering and illicit financial flows to hide using the South African financial system It forms part of the number of instruments we have as a country to fight white-collar crime in both the private and public sector Cabinet was apprised by the Minister of Finance that consultations are ongoing and will be finalised soon so as to ensure the process of promulgating the regulations that will effect the Financial Intelligence Centre Act Cabinet decisions The Minister of Finance briefed Cabinet on the recent International Monetary Fund/World Bank Spring meetings, Investor Roadshow and the WEF on Africa meeting He further briefed Cabinet on the G20 Compact with Africa proposals, and investors

trg_text: Cabinet reiterated that it remains committed to the fiscal policy trajectory outlined in the Budget Speech 2017; the implementation of reforms to improve governance in state-owned companies; maintain the expenditure ceiling and ensuring stabilization of government debt Government s programme on fast-tracking the implementation of structural reforms aimed at boosting economic growth, as contained in the Nine-Point Plan, remains relevant to addressing some of the issues raised by investor Cabinet welcomes the recently released report by EY Consultancy firm on the Foreign Direct Investment in Afric The report names South Africa as one of the largest economic hub and that it is ranked second in the 2017 Africa Attractiveness Inde Cabinet was also apprised on the upcoming visits by the rating agencies to interact with a number of organisations and government executive

trg_text: The strategy seeks to propose interventions that will reduce GHG emissions within the sustainable development principle Cabinet approved that South Africa joins the Smart Africa Allianc This is an African-led collaboration focusing on developing relevant solutions and sharing resources to address the development challenges facing the continen It places Information and Communications Technologies at the centre of the Development Agenda 2063 of African countrieSouth Africa will benefit both economically and politically through its participation in Smart AfricBy positioning the South African industry and expertise at the heart of Smart Africa s development agenda, South Africa will contribute to the growth of local business in the regio Cabinet approved the promulgation of the Department of Basic Education National Policy on Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), Sexually Transmitted Infections and Tuberculosis (TB).

trg_text: The 1999 policy focused on universal precautions and biomedical aspects of prevention, and less on the structural, social and behavioral drivers of HIThis policy proposes a paradigm shift towards approaching HIV as a core management issue using a public-health approach, as well as the inclusion of TB as a priority within schools, amongst other The scope of application is widened to learners, educators and officials, in public as well as independent schools Bills Cabinet approved the introduction of the Airports Company Amendment Bill, 2017 and the Air Traffic and Navigation Services Amendment Bill to Parliamen Amendments in these two Bills seek to provide for a permanent regulatory structur They also provide for the setting up of appeal mechanism committees, which will serve to resolve disputes Upcoming events

src_text: Nanoma kunjalo, imimoya lengcolile lekhicitwa ngumkhakha wetitfutsi ifaka ligalelo kusamba semimoya lengcolile letfunyiswa emoyeni (i-GHG), bese kutsi titfutsi temgwaco tona tifaka ligalelo lelikhulu kakhul Lelisu lifuna kuphakamisa tinyatselo tekungenelela letitawunciphisa kutfuyiswa kwe-GHG ngekhatsi kwetinchubomgomo tekutfutfuka lokusimemIkhabhinethi ivumile kutsi iNingizimu Afrika ijoyine i-Smart Africa AlliancLena yinhlangano yekusebentisana leholwa yi-Afrika lenenjongo yekutfutfukisa tisombululo kanye nekwabela imitfombolusito yekubukana netinsayeya tentfutfuko lelivekati lelibukene nat Kubeka Ithekhinoloji Yelwati Lwetekuchumana enkhabeni ye-ajenda yetentfutfuko yemave ase-Afrika yanga-2063.INingizimu Afrika itawuzuza ngekwetemnotfo netepolitiki ngekuhlanganyela kwayo kuSmart AfricNgekubeka timboni nemakhono aseNingizimu Afrika enkhabeni ye-ajenda yentfutfuko ye-Smart Africa, iNingizimu Afrika itawufaka ligalelo ekukhuleni kwemabhizinisi endzawo kulesigodzIkhabhinethi ikuvumile kumenyetelwa kweNchubomgomo yaVelonkhe yeLitiko Letemfundvo Lesisekelo yeLigciwane leNgculazi (i-HIV), Tifo Letitsatselwana Ngekwemacansi (ema-STI) kanye neSifo Sesifuba (i-TB).Inchubomgomo yanga-1999 yagcila ekucapheleni jikelele nakutinhlangotsi tekuvikela tebhayoloji nekwelashwa, futsi yagcila kancane kukuhleleka, nakuloko lokuchubela embili i-HIV kwetenhlalo kanye netindlela tekutiphatsLenchubomgomo iphakamisa indlela leyehlukile yekubukana neSandvulelangculazi (i-HIV) njengeludzaba loluyinkhaba lwekulawula kusetjentiswa indlela yetemphilo yemmango, kanye nekufaka ekhatsi kubekwa embili kwekwelashwa kwesifo sesifuba etikolweni, emkhatsini waletinye tintf Lenchubomgomoitawufaka ekhatsi bantfu labanyenti labafana
trg_text: Cabinet approved the Draft Reviewed Rural Transport Strateg The strategy responds to the priorities of rural district municipalities and provinces, by addressing the inadequate provision of Rural Transport Infrastructure and services which limits socio-economic developmenImplementation of this strategy will contribute towards the development of the local and provincial economy by improving access to public transpor This will increase connectivity between urban and rural spaces, with a view to integrating the rural environment into the mainstream econom Cabinet approved the Comprehensive Maritime Transport Polic This articulates government s commitment to the growth, development and transformation of South Africa s maritime transport sector, in support of socio-economic development while contributing to international tradThis is in line with the government priorities relating to Operation Phakisa on growing the Oceans Econom It is also aligned to broader goals of promoting economic growth and boosting job creation, as outlined in the NDP and National Infrastructure Pla Cabinet approved the publication of the Draft Green Transport Strategy for public comment Transport plays a key role in enabling global trade in an economically, socially and environmentally sustainable manne Transport systems form the backbone of South Africa s socio-economic activities by enabling the movement of people and good However, emissions from the transport sector contribute to the country s total greenhouse gas emissions (GHG), with road transport being the leading contributo

src_text: I-Indaba Yetekuvakasha yanga-2017 itawuphindze futsi ikhutsate futsi yesekele kugucuka lokuchubekako nekutfutfuka kwemboni yetekuvakasha yaseNingizimu Afrika ikakhulu indzima ledlalwa bosomabhizinisi kanye nebanikati bemabhizinisi lamancanENingizimu Afrika kwefika tivakashi letingetulu kwetigidzi le-10 nga-2016, 13% lokungetulu kwaletefika nga-2015.
trg_text: President Zuma will deliver the opening address at the 2017 Tourism Indaba, which will be hosted at the Inkosi Albert Luthuli International Convention Centre in Durban between 16 and 18 May 2017.This is the international Indaba that will again showcase South Africa s products and services in the tourism and hospitality secto Tourism Indaba 2017 will also promote and support the ongoing transformation and development of the South African tourism industry, notably the role entrepreneurs and small-business owners plaIn South Africa, more than 10 million international tourists arrived in 2016, 13% more than 2015.

src_text: Lomkhankhaso utawufundzisa, ucaphelise uphindze futsi ukhulumisane nemmango mayelana nekusebentisa kahle emandla, kutfola emandla lanele, naletinye tindzaba tetinye tinhlobo temandla nekutsi konkhe loku kubaluleke kanjani kutindlela lasetjentiswa ngato emandla emakhaya, emabhizinisini nasetimboninLwabiwomali lweMatiko lwanga-2017 lwangeNkhwekhweti 2017 luveta litfuba lekutsi ematiko etfule ePhalamende nakummango jikelele kutsi atawuyisebentisa kanjani Imali labelwe yona nga-2017.
trg_text: The new Metrorail (People's) trains are part of the new fleet that will be rolled out by government over the next 10 to 15 years as part of PRASA s Modernization Programm This initiative will create thousands of sustainable jobs and job opportunities, with the manufacturing plant for the new trains underway in Nigel, Ekurhulen It is the beginning of the operationalization of the French and Brazil Agreement signed between PRASA and Alsto The new state-of-the-art Metrorail (People's) trains offer unparalleled levels of comfort and service, and will transform commuters

trg_text: The Department of Arts and Culture is leading a number of activities which are aimed at promoting African unit The activities will culminate in a luncheon hosted by President Zuma at the Sefako Makgatho Presidential guesthouse on 25 May 2017.

src_text: Lemisebenti itawufika esicongweni mhla tinge-25 Inkhwekhweti 2017 lapho khona Mengameli Zuma utawungenisa umcimbi wesidlo sahulumende eSefako Makgatho Presidential Guesthous Timenywa talomcimbi kutawuba baholi betinhlangano tebantfu labangasibo bakuleli kepha lababahlali bakuleli laseNingizimu Afrika Mengameli lahlangane nabo nga-201 Kutfunyelwa kwembutfo wetekuvikela wavelonkhe waseningizimu Afrika (i-SANDF) uyosebenta kulenye indzawo Ikhabhinethi iyasemukela sincumo saMengameli Jacob Zuma sekwelulwa kwesikhatsi lesitawutsatfwa yi-SANDF eDemocratic Republic of Congo (e-DRC).
trg_text: Invited to the luncheon will be the leaders of organisations of foreign nationals resident in South Africa, which the President met with during 201 SANDF deployment

src_text: Loku kungumtamo wekufaka ligalelo kutekuthula nekutinta kulelivekati lase-Afrika ikakhulu sigodzi ngekuhambisana netibopho tetfu tekubukana nemave angaphandle nenchubomgomo yetfu yekuphatsa emave angaphandle yekufaka ligalelo ku-Afrika nemhlaba lonconSamba lesi-1 371 semalunga e-SANDF sitfunyelwe e-DRC kuyokwesekela Imitamo Yenhlangano Yamhlabuhlangene Yekuletsa Kutint Sikhatsi sekusebenta kwawo selulilwe sesuswa kumhla lu-01 Mabasa 2017 sayiswa kumhla tinge-31 Indlovulenkhulu 2013 Kutfumela umbutfo wetfu wetekuvikela kulelivekati kwesekela lokuchubekako kwetinchubo tesigodzi nelivekati tekuphendvula nekukusombula tinhlekele, kukhutsata nekuvikela, kucinisa kuhlangana kwesigodzi, kukhulisa ngemandla kuhwebelana emkhatsini wemave ase-Afrika kanye nekuhola intfutfuko lesimememe e-Afrik

src_text: OR Tambo leliGolide (munye)ukhishwa kweMbiko we-17 Wekhomishini yeTekucashwa Ngekulingana yiNdvuna yeTetisebenti, M Mildred Oliphant kukhombisa kucinisa inhloko ekushayeni ngelunyawo lwelunwabu kwetingucuko etindzaweni tekusebenta letinyenti letehlukene eNingizimu Afrik LoMbiko ukhombisa kutsi sisesekhashane kakhulu nekuzuza tisebenti letimelela ngeliciniso sive setf Bantfu labamnyama, bomake nebantfu labakhubatekile basachubeka nekuba ngulabamelelwa kancane kuto tonkhe tinhlangotsi teKucashwa ngeKulinganaombiko ukhombise kutsi bantfu labamhlophe basetikhundleni tekuphatsa letiphakeme talelive benta-68% kumikhakha yahulumende naletimele, emahlandla laphindzeke kasitfupha ebantfu labanemdlandla ngekwetemnotf Bantfu labamnyama bente-1 walabaphetse etikhundleni letiphakemeakubukwa sidzingo lesiphutfumako sekugucula umnotfo nekucinisekisa kukhula lokuphelele, loku akweneli mbamb Ikhabhinethi iyasemukela simememtelo seNdvuna yeTetisebenti sekutsi ibuketa ludzaba lwekusebentisa tindlela leticinile tekubukana nekungahambisani nemtsetf Imilayeto1Ikhabhinethi ijoyina Mengameli Jacob Zuma ekuhalaliseleni Um Emmanuel Macron, lokhetfwe kuba nguMengameli (kodvwa losengakacali kwenta umsebenti wakhe wekwengamela) waseRiphabhuliki yaseFrance, ngemuva kwekuphumelela kwakhe elukhetfweni lwaMengameli lwaseFrance lwamhla ti-7 Inkhwekhweti 2017.INingizimu Afrika ikulindzele kusebentisana nahulumende waseFrance ngaphasi kwebuholi baMnu Macron kuhlanganisa budlelwano lobucinile lesebuvele bukhona betepolitiki, bemnotfo nekuhwebelana emkhatsini weNingizimu Afrika neFrancekhabhinethi ihalalisela umphatsidolobha waseJozi waphambilini, nasihlalo weNhlangano yaBohulumende Bekhaya eNingizumu Afrika (i-Salga), Parks Tau ngekubekwa kwakhe esikhundleni sekuba ngulomunye wabosihlalo wePhaneli Letimele Lesezingeni Leliphakeme yaMhlabuhlangene (i-UN) kutsi engamele kusebenta ngemphumelelo kwe-Habitat IILoluhlelo lwemukelwe yi-UN kutsi lusheshise kutinikela kwemave emhlaba ekwenteni tindzawo letingemadolobha lokusimemeitiko Letekuhwebelana Netetimboni (i-dti) libuye ekhaya nemklomelo lohamba embili wekukhangisa wemave angaphandle
